history.title: Our History
history.subtitle: Over 35 years serving the Mauritanian economy
history.metaDescription: The history of BAMIS since its founding in 1985

1985.title: Foundation
1985.description: Establishment of "Banque Al Baraka Mauritanienne Islamique" on September 21, 1985, as a result of a partnership between Saudi investors and Mauritanian businessmen, with an initial capital of 500 million MRO.

1992-1995.title: First Restructuring
1992-1995.description: The Central Bank transferred its stake to private Mauritanian shareholders in 1992. Capital was increased to 3.7 billion MRO, with the Al Baraka Group becoming the majority shareholder at 87.8%.

1996-2001.title: Ownership Transition
1996-2001.description: In 1996, Al Baraka transferred its shares to Mauritanian shareholders who took majority control. The bank's name became "Banque Al Wava Mauritanienne Islamique (BAMIS)" in November 2001.

1999-2011.title: Mauritanization
1999-2011.description: Capital restructuring to 2 billion MRO in 1999 under new management. In 2011, the Al Baraka Group sold its remaining shares, making BAMIS "a bank owned 100% by private Mauritanian individuals".

2009-2019.title: Growth Phase
2009-2019.description: Successive capital increases: 5.5 billion MRO (2009), 7 billion MRO (2012), 9 billion MRO (2016), and 1.013 billion MRU (2019) following the currency change. Main shareholders include Mohamed Abdallahi Ould Abdallahi and NASR.

today.title: Market Impact
today.description: The institution finances vital sectors including urban transport, industrial fishing, and SMEs, with a network of 9 branches and 14+ ATMs throughout Mauritania.

keyFigures.title: Key Figures
keyFigures.subtitle: BAMIS financial performance and growth indicators

observations.title: Key Observations
observations.obs1: Total assets increased by 13.5% in 2021, reaching 5,672 million MRU
observations.obs2: The credit portfolio experienced remarkable 20% growth in 2021
observations.obs3: Deposits increased by 13%, reflecting customer confidence
observations.obs4: Share capital remains stable at 1,013 million MRU

message.para1: It is with great pleasure that I welcome you to BAMIS's renewed website, reflecting our commitment to digital transformation and our adaptation to the Mauritanian currency redenomination.
message.para2: Our bank has experienced remarkable organizational improvements in recent years in terms of profitability, human resources development, and modernization of our information systems.
message.para3: I invite you to discover and subscribe to our innovative digital offerings:
message.para4: We also offer national GIMTEL and international VISA cards for withdrawals, payments, and transfers through our ATM network.
message.para5: Innovation and quality are our main competitive advantages. We are committed to maintaining our leadership position while serving our customers responsibly.
message.para6: This website serves as a dialogue platform designed to strengthen our customer relationships and organizational transparency.
